snippet: Hurricane Sandy toppled more than 8,000 street trees and destroyed thousands more in parks and woodlands. The largest could take decades to replace.
abstract: Hurricane Sandy inflicted a beating on New York City trees, toppling more than 8,000 street trees and destroying thousands more in parks and woodlands; Parks Dept officials say cleanup has reached nearly $12 million, and continues to rise daily.
lead_paragraph: Hurricane Sandy toppled more than 8,000 street trees and destroyed thousands more in parks and woodlands. The largest could take decades to replace.

headline.seo: Hurricane Sandy Inflicted a Beating on New York City Trees
headline.main: Storm Inflicted a Beating on City Trees
headline.print_headline: Storm Inflicted A Beating On City Trees
